intro: Rouliniella foetida, commonly known as the stinking violets, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in wetlands and moist woodlands. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a distinctive, often unpleasant odor. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
